TopicTitle: [0.23.5] Soviet Soyuz Rocketfamily v2.4 (13.May - Russian Tulip and more)

Articles.Content:
Here's the latest version:

I added wings to it.

Download coming soon.

Edited May 1, 2013 by Giggleplex777
Nice work enlarging the front section of the soyuz Giggleplex... I'll feed that back in to my next wave of Munas. My design has come full circle back to me with improvements!

sry guys for not beeing here the last days but i had a very troublsome time. nevertheless, i updated my Rockets, played around with some details, minor improvments on the look and my Soyuz spacecraft. i will stay with the sphere probcore for the "small" topversion of the Soyuz Spacecraft.

sadly i had not the time to rework the enginecluster like giggleplex, so for the next update, engines are on the shedule. so far, i'm happy with the look of the Rockets and i think that the engines will be the last big update.

hrm ... currently i plan to upgrade the Soyuz to a more powerfull rocket. with thee the real looking engineclusters, i can't lift heavy paylods into LKO, but i plan to build my second spacestation with the Soyuz, so a rework to heavyduty clusters will be done. Are you guys intersted in this Project too? A workhorse Soyuz for Stationparts? i have to say, that i'm not going to build a very big station. only something like MIR or ISS inspired. thepayloadmass will be around 10 to max.20 tons.

Awesome thread for an awesome looking family of rockets. I've posted this elsewhere, but this seems like a good place to show it too.

More pictures + craft file here
I need a two or three man capable Soyuz craft to sit atop my large engine and booster stages. I was able to do a manned Mun-and-return mission with a single kerbal, so it seems pretty capable.

with such a large rocket, a three-kerbal mun-mission shoud not be a problem. the question is: how should it look? to build a good looking Soyuz spacecraft with the big 3man capsule is the problem.

edit:

okay 10 minutes of brainstorming can be awesome i think you can work with such a design. it's far from being "good" but ... well i can fit the role of a threeman Soyuz. lot's of upgrades still need in look.

-actiongroup 1 for solarpanels and antenna

-> 3 Man Soyuz <-

Edited May 7, 2013 by Darth Lazarus

There was this one on reddit recently:

http://imgur.com/a/awE9c

okay, the one ond reddit is far superior in design, but the orbital module on top of teh Soyuzcraft could be more "rounder". as i said. lot's of things to improve. but i realy like teh service module. very nice looking
Don't forget the landing retro rockets!
are these R24-77 with a small tank inside? and i have to say your idea in hiding the parachute is superior ! ^^

are these R24-77 with a small tank inside? and i have to say your idea in hiding the parachute is superior ! ^^

Yes they are.

Let me take a shot at a 3-kerbal Soyuz.

Edited May 7, 2013 by Giggleplex777

okay you two guys, you really got me working now on a 3-kerbal Soyuz Spacecraft. i have some ideas about the Orbital module and i will include retrorockets. i would say: two engieners with two designs: what can go wrong? the rsult will be an awesome 3-kerbal Soyuz.

(you are great in distracting me from upgrading my engineclusters on the R-7s )
I'm really excited because it will give me something to attach to my design. It's just begging for an accurate payload.

Good to see more progress Just to keep the space race nice and balanced I've just made this!... now the West can compete in a more authentic craft too!

Saturn V with Apollo CM and Lander.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/28073-0-19-Munbug-V-Now-80-more-Apollo!-New-Jool-V-Rocket-New-CM-New-Lander!

Here. Have a Proton

GusTurbo, can you build the launcher for my Soyuz 7K? I'm too lazy to build it right now.

It has a second stage and a fuel tank for the first stage.

Download

I've thrown together your craft, although I may have messed up the staging. Still, works like a charm. It has some ASAS wobble, but locking gimbals on the boosters helps. I've set that as action group 1. Let me know what you think.

Download:

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/6472509/GT%20Soyuz-7K%20T3x.craft
which parts are those for that proton?It has NP,but the other stuff...

I spent some time creating a more realistically sized Soyuz craft. I had to get a bit creative with the parts. It technically seats 3 Kerbals, even though it starts with only one.

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/6472509/Soyuz%20EX2.craft

And I totally forgot to add solar panels.

The engines are attached to two cubic struts.

Edited May 8, 2013 by Giggleplex777

which parts are those for that proton?It has NP,but the other stuff...

Only NP and KW, with some stock thrown in. No plugins used.

Based on my own experience, you can already recreate kerbalize any real life rocket you want with only KW Rocketry and NovaPunch Reloaded along with stock, provided that it won't need any specific parts pack.

Oh - and I've been doing it from the start (don't bump that thread though, I'll recreate the new lost thread)
